experience.title: Experience
experience.intro: Roles and dates exactly as on my CV.

items.role: European Type Approval Engineer (K9 N1 multi-brand)
details: Prepare and manage EC type-approval documentation for Stellantis/Toyota light commercial (N1) projects; ensure audit-ready dossiers before CNRV submission.
Maintain regulatory compliance and FCM/marking updates across model families; interface with UTAC/CNRV.
Own homologation databases, status tracking, and change management through the certification lifecycle.

items.role: Engineering Leader — Braking System (B1318 / R1312 / K1320)
details: Built and executed validation strategy for CMFB (PFC lot) aligned to gate plan; secured parts availability and test resources.
Authored component validation plans for BRAKE-DISK, Mastervac, ESP10, MKC2; monitored system and customer performance KPIs.
Drove QCDP objectives; enforced RTC/NRL checks; ensured OneTD & SIGNE compliance for RL2 gates.
Coordinated engineering, procurement, suppliers, logistics, and manufacturing for steering components from development to industrialisation.
Administered ONEVAL progress, RGPQP milestones, and LUP deliverables to maintain project readiness.
Kept decision logs and ensured availability of parts/resources for builds.
Led product/process development from TGA to MA, meeting Renault Design System specs.
Delivered FTR/OTD across design dossiers, BOM/DEVO, IMDS, dimension chains, and quality docs (NRL, NDL, QDR, DDMRS-FMEA, RTC).
Owned validation plans/tests (ONEVAL) and usage recommendations; managed critical components (hub bearings Gen2/Gen3, knuckles, discs, splash guards, rear axles, wheel carrier plates).
Designed and integrated plastic parts in CATIA V5 to injection rules (min thickness, draft, rigidity).
Key parts: tail-lamp bracket, rear bumper skins, skid plate, tow hook, side brackets, sensor brackets including central parking sensor.
Ran feasibility and shape-plan reviews and coordinated with programme teams.
